config-import.title: Import Configuration
config-import.description: Import your settings from an old installation
config-import.profileNamePlaceholder: e.g. imported-config (leave empty for auto-generated name)
config-import.profileNameHelp: This name will be used for the imported profile. If a profile with this name already exists, a timestamp will be added automatically.
config-import.pathInvalid: Invalid path. No configuration files found.
config-import.conflictWarning: Warning: Some files already exist and will be overwritten
config-import.noFilesFound: No configuration files found in the selected path

help.title: Help
help.description: This plugin helps you import your settings from an old installation.
help.step1: 1. Enter the full path of your old installation
help.step2: 2. Optional: Enter a name for the imported profile
help.step3: 3. Click 'Validate path' to check if configuration files exist
help.step4: 4. If the path is valid, click 'Import settings'
help.note: Note: If a profile with the same name exists, a unique name will be generated automatically.
help.legacyNote: This plugin also supports older versions with database.db in the main directory.
help.subdirNote: The system automatically searches for config files in the app/ subdirectory if they are not found in the main directory.
